intro: Eremopyxis, commonly known as the desert grass or sand grass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plants typically have narrow leaves and produce small, spike-like inflorescences. Eremopyxis species are often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall. These plants play a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
